headline: Easy Baked Chicken Cordon Bleu
description: Easy recipe that tastes like you cooked all day. Chicken breasts are wrapped around ham and mozzarella cheese for a change in this version of the classic baked dish.
name: Easy Baked Chicken Cordon Bleu
recipeIngredient: 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/2 inch thickness

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Lay out the pounded chicken breasts on a clean surface. Place a slice of ham on each piece, then one stick of cheese. Roll the chicken up around the cheese and ham, and secure with toothpicks. Dip each roll in melted butter, then roll in bread crumbs. Place in a shallow baking dish.
Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken is browned and juices run clear.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is so easy. I use string cheese in the center, which works out great. When pounding the chicken do it as thin as possible for tenderness.
I used provolone because I had it in the fridge, my husband who insists he does not like chicken really liked it and said this is a keeper.
Easy, yet impressive. Really tasty too!
I had to make my own version because I didn't have all the stuff I needed, however it turned out delicious
Easy to make and everyone in the family loved it
Super easy - follow the recipe. Delish!
It was delicious! I added a creamy chicken gravy. Really good!
This was so simple and delicious! I substituted provolone slices and it turned out so moist.
I have made this several times. I freeze the cheese sticks first. It prevents it from melting out of the chicken during cooking.
I seasoned my chicken with Tony chacheres. After cooking, I sprinkled it with fresh lemon. Amazing!!!

Replaced breadcrumbs with Panko seasoned with Cajun and Italian seasoning. Used Swiss deli slices instead of mozzarella. After 40 minutes cooking, added 1/2 slice Swiss on top and broiled until Swiss began to bubble. Very moist and tasty.

This is a Wonderful dish!
I used Panko and ground up garlic croutons instead of breadcrumbs so it took the coating up a level.
I am not a fan of swiss so the cheese sticks were a brilliant
idea!!! I think they even made it easier to roll the cordon bleu and skewer them.
Thank you for sharing this!!! I will make this again and again!
Easy and good!
It was very good. Cooked it on the stove to brown and then baked it in the oven for about 20 minutes. Made it for New Years Eve.
I didn't make any changes and I will make it again. Very easy recipe and tasty too.

I always have to make some kind of change (it's a compulsion). I used 2 flattened breasts topped with 1/4 of a thinly-sliced (~1/8" thick) ham steak and 2 slices Sargento Ultra-Thin Swiss for each. Poultry twine was substituted for toothpicks, and breadcrumbs from homemade Italian bread topped it all off. 

This was delicious! When I make this again, I'll use larger chicken breasts, since my husband wanted to know if there was more
Easy & delicious!
I did not make any changes and I will do it again

This is a great easy recipe. I recommend using whatever kind of cheese you want to make it your own, and the kind of ham you prefer. The recipe was easy to follow and a complete hit. Timing even worked perfectly.

Delicious!!! I soaked the chicken in brine for 20 minutes prior to rolling it with the ham and cheese. We were out of bread crumbs but had oat bran (I have no idea why we had oat bran, but it seemed like a good idea. Healthier anyway, right?). So, I mixed 1 cup of oat bran with 2 Tablespoons of Italian seasoning and used it as a substitute. I might actually do that from now on when a recipe calls for bread crumbs!
I used Swiss cheese and Panko instead of bread crumbs. Very good but would incorporate a sauce next time.
I used Swiss cheese in mine. I will make this again for sure. It keeps me from standing at the stove.
very DILISH

I used Swiss cheese as I know that string cheese is tough and doesn't melt well. I also sautéed the Panko coated chicken/ham/cheese rolls without using an egg wash. The pounded chicken is sticky enough to cause the bread crumbs (Panko) to stick. After lightly browning in 3 Tbsp of oil, I placed the rolls in an oven proof dish, added the sauce and baked for 30 minutes at 350F. Delicious and tender. Great Recipe.
I followed the recipe exactly and man, it was delicious! Using string cheese was a nifty trick :) My boyfriend never likes anything I cook and he LOVED this... So thanks for that too!!
I used swiss cheese as that is the traditional ingredient and it was really awesome.
Very good recipe...I was looking for a recipe to use up some leftover ham and I decided on this recipe. My husband does not like sauce so this particular recipe worked out great for us.

I followed some suggestions of others and tried some rolled and some with pockets. Both worked and were a little messy. make sure you have large enough chicken breasts. Mine were on the smaller size which made fitting everything difficult. I also made the sauce from another recipe as suggested by some others who complained about it being dry. I didn't find it to be dry at all but did enjoy the sauce. However, I didn't feel like it added that much so I probably won't make it again. Overall, I really enjoyed this recipe. I've always loved chicken cordon bleu and was really happy wth this easy take on it!
This was pretty simple and tasty. The only drawbacks were that it took an hour in the oven to get done, and the cheese didn't melt. If I make it again, I will use shredded cheese instead.
It was great. Very versatile. You could do different cheeses, and more meats too. Imagine this with swiss and pastrami instead of ham. MMmmm. =)

My husband loves this! It's easy and makes ordinary chicken a little more exciting. I don't bother pounding the chicken I just slice mine in half width-wise. (I'm not a chef and don't really enjoy cooking as much as I love eating). We love eating the melty cheese that oozes out of the chicken, be sure to line your pan with tin foil.- To that point- you can half the cheese sticks, that way, there isn't so much oozing out of the ends. Also, since it is kind of messy to make, I usually make up two batches and freeze one. Frozen chicken cooks up quick and easy on a busy weeknight. :)
This was a quick and easy recipe, I did put Campbell's chicken gravy on the bottom of baking dish (first put tinfoil in pan : ) so it wouldnt be dry .. My kids&husband ate it all thanks
Easy and nummy. My kids liked it.
I was amazing. It taste awesome. It was a surprise for my wife and she loved it.
Used sliced Swiss cheese instead of string cheese. So good. Actually got my husband to try this and he really liked it.

Love this recipe! I didn't have Swiss cheese on hand so I used what I had Cooper cheese! Turned out finger licking good! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe. I did make a sauce to pour over once the chicken was done. I mixed cornstarch and heavy whipping cream with little black pepper, onion powder and 2 slices of Cooper cheese over low heat for 2 mins
My boys enjoyed this recipe. The final product looked appetizing and tasted delicious. We will make this again.
Made this for my family of 24 for New Years weekend and they loved it ! Eas;y to make for a crowd and so yummy. Definately a winner !
I made this with pepper jack cheese and it was awesome! To reduce the fat content, I sprayed the chicken with olive oil and then coated them in bread crumbs.
Good recipe! I added cream of chicken soup for a sauce and it was awesome!

I loved the results of your recipe. I followed the instructions exactly and found them to be right on point. The taste was wonderful and I will be using this over and over again. Thanks for the great recipe!
VERY GOOD
my hubby said these were just okay!
Love it, easy recipe and I made it with Blue, Mozzarella and Swiss Cheese. This is a keeper, thank you for sharing.
This is the best chicken cordon blue ever I like the string mozzarella cheese so much better then the usual Swiss. This is melt in your mouth favorite at our house

I just made this and the family loved it! My husband and I are on a low carb diet so the only thing I changed was the breading. I used crunched up pork rinds and it gave it a slight kick!!! Will make this again next week!!!! It's easy and great tasting!!!
Great! Needed more butter, crumbs.

Great recipe! I used Cajun seasoning on chicken breast before rolling with ham & havarti cheese. I also added a few dashes of Hungarian paprika & cayenne pepper to bread crumbs. Huge hit at party with the extra kick in the seasoning. Served with Hollandaise sauce to many rave reviews!
Simple to make and very good. I used sliced deli ham and sliced deli Swiss cheese instead of string cheese.
This was an excellent and easy fancy meal choice. I put a pat of butter on top and that kept it moist. Really delicious. My husband would like this to be part of our regular meals.
FABULOUS AND EASY

This was incredibly easy. I didn't have ham, so I used turkey. I also didn't have cheese sticks, so I used cheddar cheese. Instead of chicken breast I used tenders and cut everything else in half to fit. Worked out great and tasted wonderful! Everyone loved it! It will be another go to recipe.
Try substituting Pepperoni for the ham.

I make this using thin deli ham and cheese slices. Usually use Swiss or muenster cheese. Pepper jack works, too. My kids and husband love it and there are never any leftovers! I also use panko breadcrumbs for the extra crunch.

I love how EASY this recipe is, and yet it yields a very nice "change of pace" chicken dinner that is special. I added a little grated parmesan cheese to my breadcrumbs, and used some provolone cheese slices instead of mozzarella since I had some to use up and we definitely enjoyed this meal! Served with a Caesar Salad and some garlic texas toast. Yumm!
Easy and good! I used a spoonful of Boursin cheese rather than the string to give it a little more flavor.will make it again.
I love this recipe, I just substitute low fat cheese as well as a butter substitute when I cook this.
I follow the recipe for the bread crumbs I use New York Texas toast Seasoned croutons and crush them and dip chicken in egg and milk mixture and into crumbs, I use this croutons for dipping fish too.
I made it exactly as directed and loved it! I made one with extra ham instead of any cheese because I have a cheese hater :)
Easy to prepare. Added a a title honey mustard.
Made this tonight for dinner. Wonderful!!!! Easy and quick. I used a slice of swiss cheese instead of the cheese stick and all enjoyed. I was told this should be a repeat for sure!

This was quick, easy and was a hit for dinner.
I did not have bread crumbs on hand so I opened a pack of Onion soup mix and dipped the chicken in the butter and pressed just one side of the chicken into the mix. (The mix is strong out of the package and I felt one side coated was enough.) I sprinkled what was left of the mix between the breast chicken and poured the rest of the butter into the bottom of the pan, Perfect sauce on the bottom(butter and onion soup mix) and still crispy on the top,
meh... it wasn't the greatest. My boyfriend hated it, and he loves everything. It's better with honey mustard drizzle. Won't be making this again though.

I pounded the chicken out flat -, I used deli thin ham ,shredded mozzarella cheese, closed with tooth picks, rolled in butter and rolled generously in Panko Italian flavored bread crumbs baked at 350 for 45 minutes..... made a white wine sauce consisting of 1/2 stick butter, 1 cup white wine, 1/2 cup milk , thicken with corn starch then blend with emulsion blender ALL I CAN SAY IS AWESOME!!

I tried this recipe and it was great. I didn't use string cheese I used slice and it was messy and cooked all out but my family loved it and the chicken was very moist. I added extra seasoning to my bread crumbs. I will try string cheese the next time.
This recipe was great and very easy! I used regular mozzarella.
I really liked this. My hubby and daughter did not care for it. They wanted the cheese to melt more.

This was really tasty, although the cheese sticks didn't really melt. In the future, I will use reg mozz and also, if you can't get the chick breasts pounded thin enough (which I can't) it needs to stay in the oven 10-15 min longer.

WOW!! Super Yummy!! I used left over ham from Easter and mozzerella cheese slices. I missed the sauce just a little and will make it next time. Easy after work kind of meal - thank you - thank you - thank you!!
Actually really easy to make but next time I will use shake n bake mix for coating. I also put spicy brown mustard on the chicken before adding the ham.
This tasted great, but I could not get this chicken to brown. Any suggestions? I increased the heat, cooked 10 minutes longer than called for and even put it under the broiler for about 5 minutes.

this recipe was de-lish! i didnt have the option of pounding them so i butterflied them and boy did they turned out huge but they were a hit with my boyfriend! and the sauce that goes with it that everyone talk about is worth making just a 1/4 tsp of salt to it yum!
This recipe was easy and quick, it turned out fantastic! I made my own breadcrumbs for my own little touch..was de-lish!!!

My husband is definitely not a chef. He really wanted to make dinner and this is what he did. It was yummy and looked super impressive. I only give it 4 because I'd probably want some sort of sauce for the next time I make it. Having said that, the cheese and ham kept the chicken from drying out. We served with mashed potatoes so the sauce wouldn't been great to smoosh all together. If you did make a sauce, you wouldn't need much! Thanks for helping to make my hubby feel like a pro!

Very good and simple. Way too much butter, however, I ended up tossing about half of it out. Takes practice to get the chicken rolled neatly - mine definitely did not look like the picture, but they tasted good.
Use Swiss cheese slices and it's a 5+ star recipe!
Very good; very easy; very likely to be a repeat dish in my house!
Excellent with grated mozzarella instead of the cheese sticks. So easy but so tasty, and fancy.
So simple, so Good!
Very moist and delicious. I used smoked Gouda because it's our favorite cheese.
My family loved it. I didn't have bread crumbs. So I used garden flavored croutons & and rolled them into crumbs. I also used sliced Swiss cheese and sandwich ham. Loved how simple the recipe was.
I did as some others mentioned and cut a pocket in the chicken instead of pounding it because I had nothing to pound it with. Otherwise I followed the recipe and it was delicious, thanks for sharing!

Yummy! I made 2 changes, but this was a delicious, easy recipe. First change was swiss cheese, and 2nd was Panko bread crumbs. The whole family really enjoyed. So nice to make something different, but easy with chicken.
I was looking for a more healthy version than my old recipe where I browned the chicken in shortening (no wonder it was so good!). This is a good compromise.

We liked this dish. I used cheddar because I didn't have mozzarella or Swiss. I dipped the chicken in egg (based on a review for a similar recipe) and then assembled and rolled in crumbs. Added melted butter, drizzled over the top about halfway thru baking. I do think 40 minutes is a bit long...maybe I just pounded the chicken too thin or something.

I think this recipe is great, and I made it exactly as posted the first time, but I revised it a little my second time around and ended up liking it better. I used sharp cheddar cut off of a block instead of mozzarella because I find that you can taste it more, I dipped the chicken in olive oil after I had rolled it, instead of butter to make it a little healthier, I used whole wheat italian bread crumbs which have a great flavor to them. I saved the best ingredient for last: after I dipped them in the olive oil, and before I breaded them, I sprinkled both sides of the chicken with Adobo seasoning. Just that sprinkling gave it such an amazingly different flavor and I highly recommend trying it for yourself. I hope this helps someone. Enjoy!!!
So easy and awesome!

Very Good! I really thought it was going to be a disaster as I was preparing this (lil messy), but there were NO leftovers! I served this with angel hair pasta in a butter/2% milk/garlic sauce so I didn't need another sauce for the chicken. It came out very moist and tasty. I will be making this again.

This is a great dish. The only changes made were that I used swiss cheese instead of string, and Shake N' Bake coating for the crust and beaten egg instead of butter prior to coating. I also baked for 30 minutes instead of 40. The chicken was done but very juicy. I prepared some chicken gravy, just in case (as some others have suggested), but found that with the chicken being so juicy, the gravy wasn't really needed. Delicious!

My sweetheart was out tonight so I decided to make chicken "roll ups" as the kids call them. I am glad she was gone too because she would never have let me roll the chicken in melted butter preferring milk or something less fattening. I followed your recipe to the letter and found it quite delicious. Next time I will add a few herbs and spices just to make this recipe my own. I'm tossing my old recipe because it was more labor intensive and doesn't come out noticeably better.
Thanks for a relatively easy and yummy recipe.
Made last night for dinner...much easier to make than the bleu I am used to. Taste was superb! Hubby had two as did dinner guests. Awesome recipe, thanks!
This was a good recipe for valentines day. Thanks for sharing.
This was a very easy recipe to make and it was delicious!
THis was an excellent recipe however i think i pounded the chicken a little too thin because it was hard to toothpick together. I used grated mozza cheese instead of cheese strings.
Great recipe... even better with a nice creamy sauce served on top as suggested by other reviewers.

I am taking a star off just because I did change this quite a bit. It is a fantastic starting point though! I omitted the butter/breading and instead used beaten egg and almond flour to make it gluten free. Super easy and turned out Wonderfully! I also added a sauce as someone else recommended from the Chicken Cordon Bleu II recipe- which is really a great finishing touch and worth it. Thanks for a great recipe! :)
This was very good! Only complaint was the string cheese never really melted. My son enjoyed it.
Super easy and the kids beg me to make it again! And to think I wasted all that time making it from "scratch" without shortcuts. String cheese in the middle.... genius!
Per other reviewers, I covered the stuffed chicken in flour first, mixed 1/4 butter with 1/2 c. chicken broth for the "dip," and covered with panko bread crumbs. Absolutely delicious!!!
